title: Navigating Indonesia’s Future in Trump’s America
snippet: Muhammad Habib Abiyan Dzakwan analyzes Indonesia's economic diplomacy options amid the return of President Trump and rising global trade tensions, highlighting Australia’s potential role as a strategic partner.

title: Indonesia’s Democratic Survival and International Linkages
snippet: Edbert Gani Suryahudaya warns of Indonesia’s growing authoritarian tendencies amid global democratic retreat, especially following the dismantling of USAID under President Trump, which has weakened international support for democratic resilience in the Global South.

title: Distorted Reality
snippet: Vidhyandika Djati Perkasa analyzes how influence operations and hyperreality impacted rational voter behavior during Indonesia’s 2024 elections.

title: Banning Sukatani: How the Police Undermine Free Expression
snippet: An opinion piece exploring the implications of police actions in Sukatani and their impact on the freedom of expression in Indonesia.

title: A Tailored Approach to the Foreign Policy Budget
snippet: This opinion piece discusses how Indonesia's foreign policy budget can be strategically allocated to better reflect national interests and global dynamics.

title: What Does Southeast Asia Want from a New U.S. Administration?
snippet: This article explores Southeast Asia’s expectations from a new U.S. administration under President Donald Trump, including a desire for equitable partnerships, commitment to democratic values, and consistency in foreign policy.

title: The China factor in Indonesia’s BRICS ambition
snippet: China’s influence and geopolitical clout drive Indonesia’s interest in the BRICS grouping. Yet Indonesia must balance opportunities and constraints, ensuring that BRICS membership does not imply economic alignment, says Indonesian researcher Muhammad Habib Abiyan Dzakwan.

title: Don't take the upgraded CAFTA for granted
snippet: ASEAN and China must carefully address all participants' concerns and ensure the free trade area remains resilient enough to navigate through current geopolitical uncertainties.

title: Revisiting Indonesia’s surprising BRICS plan
snippet: While Indonesia criticizes the Global North for sidelining the interests of developing powers, it is not in Indonesia’s best interest to be plunged into the vortex of geopolitical rivalry, argues Muhammad Habib Abiyan Dzakwan.

title: Euforia Pembebasan Pilot dan Separatisme di Papua
snippet: Setelah 19 bulan disandera oleh TPNPB, pilot Susi Air asal Selandia Baru, Phillip Mark Mehrtens, akhirnya dibebaskan. Euforia publik atas pembebasan ini diiringi narasi politik dan operasi pemengaruh yang mencuat kembali ke permukaan.
